findings.title: Broken Functionality
findings.description: startICO function contains checks for "timeToWait should be greater than endDate" and "timeToWait should be less than endDate + 120 days" in both the checks timeToWait is used without "_". Which is incorrect as startICO function is taking _timeToWait (with "_") as the parameter where its taking value which is then getting assigned to timeToWait.

findings.title: Min purchase should be less than max purchase
findings.description: The min purchase value should be set to a lower amount than the max purchase value.

findings.title: Unnecessary copying of local variable into another local variable
findings.description: The finding indicates unnecessary copying of a local variable's value into another local variable, which can lead to inefficiency and potential security risks.

findings.title: timeToWait can be set to a value way far in future
findings.description: Malicious owner can set timeToWait to a value way far in future, thus disallowing anyone to claim their tokens, until and unless if owner decides to reduce/remove

findings.title: Public functions can be marked external to save gas
findings.description: Marking public functions as external can help optimize gas usage.

findings.title: Two different functions facilitating the same business logic
findings.description: checkContributionExt and checkContribution: two different functions facilitating the same business logic.
